pull.title: Update string for Show/Hide in the tray
pull.body:
- be clear we don't "Show/Hide Bitcoins", but just the client window
- remove the tooltip for toggleHideAction as this is not shown anyway

events.body: In that case, why not just "Show/Hide"? "Window" doesn't tell the user anything, either.
Window tells the user we are talking about the Client window, no? I'm fine with "Show / Hide" though :).
It tells the user that what gets hidden/shown is a "window". Which is always the case... it's just too generic so better to leave it out.
@laanwj Do you agree with this small pull after the last rebase?
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/ef5fc417f98c06c490ec47262eacbb5db2ffcf99 for binaries and test log.
@laanwj  Anything I can do to get this small thing merged after 24 days :-D?

Kind of lost track of this, github should really add a way to assign pull requests. 

There is a string freeze for 0.7.0 now but it can be merged after that.
@laanwj Eh, GitHub _does_ let you assign pull requests... you just need to do it from the Issues list

events.message:
Update string for Show/Hide in the tray

- be clear we don't "Show/Hide Bitcoins", but just the client window
- remove the tooltip for toggleHideAction as this is not shown anyway
- update a comment to be more general

events.body: @laanwj Is that string freeze still persistent or does this make it into 0.7 final? Just wanted to know :).

Yes this can go into rc2, though we should merge it and push to transifex
asap so people have a little time to translate it. Please remind me if I
forget this today.
Will do that, btw. I always hope you don't feel set under pressure by my remainders :) but as GUI master I need you ^^.
